newsitem.title: GUATEMALA: Four killed as small Guatemalan plane crashes.
newsitem.headline: Four killed as small Guatemalan plane crashes.

text.p: Four people were killed when a small plane crashed in a remote area of Guatemala over the weekend, rescue workers said on Tuesday.
"The plane was found completely destroyed in an inaccessible area with all four dead," Ricardo Lemus of the Guatemala City Emergency Squad told a news conference.

He identified the dead as Arni Gislason of Iceland, Felipe Monterroso Davila and Edgar Lizandro Gil Villabello of Mexico, and Jorge Moreno, the Guatemalan pilot. Further information on the dead or the purpose of the flight was not available.

Air traffic officials lost contact with the single-engine plane on Saturday near Palin, about 29 miles (46 km) from the capital, as it was travelling west to the Mexican border town of Tapachula from Guatemala City Janet Herrera, an official at the Office of Civil Aviation told Reuters.
Rescue workers located the plane on Tuesday morning on the edge of the Volcano El Fuego southwest of the capital.
An investigation into the cause of the crash was pending, Herrera said.
